Title.evidence: A Randomised Controlled Trial of Morphine and Mexiletine for Postamputation Pain

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive morphine, mexiletine, or placebo

Participants.evidence: adult patients with postamputation pain of 6 months or longer and greater than 3 on a 0–10 numeric pain rating scale

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive morphine, mexiletine, or placebo

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the change in average pain intensity from the drug-free baseline to the last week of maintenance

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed

Blinding.evidence: Patients, clinicians, and outcome assessors were blinded

Number_Analysed.evidence: data were analysed from 56 subjects for one drug period, 45 for two, and 35 who completed all three

Result_Outcome.evidence: Morphine treatment resulted in lower pain scores compared with placebo and mexiletine (P = 0.0003)

Harms.evidence: Morphine was associated with a higher rate of side effects
